author: Ryan Parry West Coast Correspondent For Dailymail.Com
title: All-American boy lands role in $100m Chinese blockbuster | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad EXCLUSIVE: How this injured all-American college football player moved to CHINA, became fluent in Mandarin and landed a leading role in $100 MILLION blockbuster 'Asura' - the highest-budget production in Chinese history Matthew Knowles began his Chinese adventure in 2009, after graduating from Clemson University, where a knee injury put an end to his footballing dreams Knowles, from Greenville, South Carolina, is now on his way to becoming one of the biggest movie stars in China and he tells his story to DailyMail.com The 31-year-old has landed a lead role in an epic $100 million blockbuster called Asura - the highest-budget production in Chinese cinema history He plays Rawa, a demigod, and stars alongside Wu Lei, one of China's most popular teen stars, and award-winning actor Tony Leung Ka-fai Although it is a Chinese movie, many insiders believe the flick will cross over into the international market and become the next Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon 'Being a 6ft 4in white man in China definitely helped me get noticed,' he says Published: 18:13 GMT, 23 February 2017 | Updated: 19:55 GMT, 23 February 2017 375 shares
